column1: Smoque BBQ////My favorite BBQ place in Chicago. Other than mac n cheese (which is just mediocre)
column2: everything else is fantastic. The succulent ribs are smoky and so soft it is so easy to pull the meat apart from the bone. The chilis here are delicious
column3: very rich and tasty. The brisket is also tender and goes well with the chilis. I usually get the coleslaw and cornbread to diversify the flavors a little bit as well. They also have a variety of BBQ sauces of course
column4: from sweet and spicy to tangy and smoky. And no matter how full I am
column5: I always wrap up my Smoque experience with some of their pecan bread pudding.
